meta.content: *We will continue to update this page as changes are announced* Are you in need of support or resources? Please call 2-1-1 from any phone to be connected to a list of statewide resources. UPDATE: April 2, 2020 – 1:00 P.M – School Building Closure Announcement Dear MMA family, Today, Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed Executive Order 2020-35, which orders all K-12 school buildings to close for the remainder of the school year — unless restrictions are lifted — and ensures the continuation of learning by setting guidelines for remote learning. It breaks my heart that we are not returning to our classrooms this academic year, but I know that our teachers are dedicated to working with you to educate our students during this unprecedented time. While teachers and students will not be returning to their classroom, our mission of educating and caring for students does not stop. According to the Executive Order, The Michigan Association of Intermediate School Administrators and the Michigan Council of Charter School Authorizers are currently developing a Continuity of Learning Plan template application for schools to utilize in order to create their localized plan. The application template will be made available to us by April 3, …

*We will continue to update this page as changes are announced* Are you in need of support or resources? Please call 2-1-1 from any phone to be connected to a list of statewide resources. UPDATE: April 2, 2020 - 1:00 P.M - School Building Closure Announcement Dear MMA family,
Today, Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed

a.span: Get To Know Our Kindergarten Teachers

h4.em: *We will continue to update this page as changes are announced*

h3.span: Are you in need of support or resources? Please call 2-1-1 from any phone to be connected to a list of statewide resources.

h2.span: UPDATE: April 2, 2020 – 1:00 P.M – School Building Closure Announcement

div.p: Dear MMA family,

Today, Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed Executive Order 2020-35, which orders all K-12 school buildings to close for the remainder of the school year — unless restrictions are lifted — and ensures the continuation of learning by setting guidelines for remote learning. It breaks my heart that we are not returning to our classrooms this academic year, but I know that our teachers are dedicated to working with you to educate our students during this unprecedented time. While teachers and students will not be returning to their classroom, our mission of educating and caring for students does not stop.

According to the Executive Order, The Michigan Association of Intermediate School Administrators and the Michigan Council of Charter School Authorizers are currently developing a Continuity of Learning Plan template application for schools to utilize in order to create their localized plan. The application template will be made available to us by April 3, 2020.

As soon as we receive the template, we will adapt our distance learning plan and seek approval from our authorizer. The governor requested that our plans begin on April 28, 2020 at the latest. It is our hope that we implement distance learning no later than 4/20/20.

Please note, all standardized tests previously scheduled for the remainder of the school year, including the M-STEP and the SAT, will be canceled. All Michigan high school seniors will be given the opportunity to graduate this year so that they may make a successful postsecondary transition. All other students will be given the opportunity to earn course credit through a variety of means that best match course objectives.

By now, you should already have been contacted by your student’s teacher or other school personnel. If you have not been contacted, or need to update your contact information, please contact your teacher or administrator by email (available on the academy’s website). Additionally, please let us know if you are in need of technology or technology support and we will try to provide resources for you.
You will receive more information on distance learning, homework guidelines or credit requirements, parent support, building access to retrieve your personal items and much more on 4/13/20.
We are in this together!
Thank you!

h2.span: UPDATE: April 1, 2020 – 1:00 P.M – Spring Break Announcement

div.p: Dear MMA Parents and Guardians,

Everyone’s world has been dramatically changed as the result of the Coronavirus pandemic, and the closure of schools and the stay-at-home order. No one in our community has not been personally affected by this

We wanted to take this time to thank you for your patience and flexibility. Information that will guide public schools and child development centers is changing day by day, and even hour by hour. We will do our best to keep you informed, knowing that some of our/your questions have yet to be answered.

One question we wanted to address today was regarding spring break. Along with our other local schools, MMA will continue with our spring break as scheduled. While we know spring break is going to look different this year with the “Stay Home, Stay Safe” order, we are still going to give our school leaders, teachers and staff the space for self-care and family time. We hope you do the same. Spring break is effective at 4 p.m. today, April 3, 2020.

Even though we will be on spring break, you may continue to use the resources your child’s teacher has provided for you during this one week time period and continue using any online resources. We are encouraging the staff to take time for themselves during spring break, so while you may send them a message, they will not be expected to reply until their return on April 13, 2020. At that time, we will update the learning opportunities and may also have more information about how the rest of the school year will go with all in-person schooling canceled.

Finally, I would like to thank our outstanding school leader, Ms. Cheryl & Ms. Michelle, teachers and staff who continue to adapt and provide instructional resources to our students and families during this extended closure time, all while caring and providing for their families at home. Our teachers are doing their best to respond to each family’s needs creatively and flexibly, meeting the individual needs of your student(s). Please note, if you have not heard from your teacher, please reach out to your school leader directly. We care about you and want to offer any help that we can.

At Choice Schools, we are very conscious that families are juggling a lot and our intent is to support you, not add to the many burdens you are shouldering. It is important to maintain two-way, open communication. If you need more support, flexibility or resources, please email your child’s teacher or school leader. We are all in this together and the health of everyone — students, staff, parents and families — is the most important thing at this time!

Thank you,
Sarah Wildey

h2.span: Important update: As of Thursday, March 12 at 11:00 PM.

div.p: Governor Gretchen Whitmer announced that in order to slow the spread of Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in Michigan, she is ordering the closure of all K-12 school buildings, public, private, and boarding, to students starting Monday, March 16 until Sunday, April 5. School buildings are scheduled to reopen on Monday, April 6.

a.class: fusion-button button-flat fusion-button-round button-large button-default button-1
a.span: Example of an at home Montessori schedule

div.h3: Q: Is there a way my child can continue learning?
div.p: A: MMA Family: please check your emails for MMA updates! Work packets for all students will be made available Monday 3/16/20 9:00am-2:00pm. Stay tuned for more information! Also, check out Facebook for ideas on additional educational resources!
div.h3: Q: I’m concerned about providing food for my children, will there be any provided to my child by the school?
div.p: A: Although school is closed for several weeks, we are providing families with an opportunity to access free breakfast and lunch for children under 18 years of age. Our intent is to make the meal distribution process as simple as possible.

span.data-sheets-value: {"1":2,"2":"We are offering free Breakfast and Lunch Wednesday-Friday (trial bases this week) 8:30-10:30pm at the carline arrival door, decision to move forward will be made based on school community participation"}

p.span: We are offering free Breakfast and Lunch Wednesday-Friday (trial bases this week) 8:30-10:30pm at the carline arrival door, decision to move forward will be made based on school community participation

div.p: Because the situation is complex and evolving, our plans may change. If they do, we’ll let you know.
*Updated 3/16/2020
div.h3: Q: Will anyone be at the school building in case I need to drop off enrollment paperwork or pick up something from my student’s locker?
div.p: A: At this time, your school is working to offer times for families. Please keep an eye out for updated information as we know more.
*Updated 3/13/2020
div.h3: Q: What do I do if I or a family member is sick?
div.p: A: According to the CDC, you need to call your doctor: If you think you have been exposed to COVID-19 and develop a fever and symptoms of respiratory illness, such as cough or difficulty breathing, call your healthcare provider immediately. Follow the steps in this link: If you are sick with COVID-19 or suspect you are infected with the virus that causes COVID-19, follow the steps below to help prevent the disease from spreading to people in your home and community. https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/steps-when-sick.html
For additional questions on monitoring your health, contact your local public health officials (Michigan: 1-517-335-9030)
div.h3: Q: Are there any restrictions on personal travel?
div.p: A: The CDC has indicated travelers returning from (SEE BELOW) specified countries must stay home for 14 days after returning from travel, monitor their health, and practice social distancing. It is recommended staff and students utilize the free virtual COVID-19 screening through your healthcare provider, if you have any concerns you may need to self-quarantine. Please see the CDC travel health notices for an updated list of travel restrictions and guidelines.
